In a message posted on X, Parsons expressed his desire to leave after feeling the team ignored his agent's attempts to negotiate a new deal, despite initial talks with owner Jerry Jones. The Cowboys have yet to comment on the trade request.

description: Apple CEO Tim Cook confirmed that the majority of iPhones sold in the US during the last quarter were manufactured in India, while China primarily serves non-US markets. Despite Trump's push for domestic production, Apple is bullish on India, witnessing record revenue growth driven by iPhone sales and planning retail expansion.

author: etimes.in
description: Chandrashekhar Siddhi, a 28-year-old comedian known for Comedy Khiladigalu Season 3, tragically died by suicide. He was found in a forest near Yellapur taluk, with police investigating the case. Siddhi, a Ninasam Theatre Institute alumnus, faced financial struggles and depression due to limited opportunities after his initial success, leading him to work as a daily wage labourer.
title: Comedy Khiladigalu fame Chandrashekhar Siddhi dies by suicide at 28

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Hollywood actress Gabrielle Union discussed her experience with menopause and motherhood. She spoke about the challenges she faced, including hot flashes and memory loss. Union also mentioned the impact of an autoimmune issue. She and Dwyane Wade welcomed their daughter, Kaavia, via surrogacy in 2018. Union had previously experienced miscarriages.
title: "It makes it hard": Gabrielle Union opens up — menopause, motherhood, and exhaustion

description: Legionnaires' disease surfaces in Harlem, New York. The outbreak sickens many and causes one death. Legionella bacteria causes this pneumonia form. The bacteria thrives in water systems. Cooling towers and spas are potential sources. Symptoms include fever and respiratory issues. Early diagnosis and treatment are crucial. Prevention involves water system maintenance. Regular cleaning and disinfection are necessary. Read more below!
title: What is Legionnaires' disease? Know causes, symptoms, risk factors, prevention and more

description: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei refuted Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's accusations that he believes only Anthropic should develop AI. description: A special NIA court's acquittal in the 2008 Malegaon blast case has revealed significant contradictions between the ATS and NIA investigations. The court cited flawed evidence, coercion, and inconsistencies in the agencies' accounts of the bomb's assembly and transportation. Concerns were raised about torture and fabricated evidence, casting doubt on the credibility of the ATS investigation.
title: Explosive in house or on bike? Malegaon blast judgement flags gaps in probe

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: In a series where bowlers from both teams have been rotated, managed, and preserved, Mohammed Siraj has been the exception, running in hard every single time. On Friday, under a gloomy London sky, he brought India back with his lion-hearted effort and never-give-up attitude, something that, in the years to come, will be celebrated even more than his trademark “Celebrappeal,” remembered instead for his heart.

Awards were also given for action direction, choreography, music, and more.

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Former Prime Minister HD Deve Gowda has strongly condemned US President Donald Trump's recent remarks describing India's economy as "dead," calling them baseless and ill-tempered. Gowda praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi for standing firm against US pressure and prioritizing India's national interests. He defended India's economic performance and criticized opposition leaders echoing Trump's sentiments.

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: India has vehemently refuted a British parliamentary committee report accusing it of transnational repression in the UK, dismissing the allegations as baseless. The Ministry of External Affairs stated that the report relies on dubious sources with a history of anti-India sentiment.

description: Sameer Kulkarni, acquitted in the Malegaon blast case, accuses Congress leaders and the Maharashtra ATS of framing Hindus for political gain. author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Bihar's draft electoral rolls omitted over 65 lakh names after a Special Intensive Revision. Patna had the highest number of missing voters. The Election Commission released new draft rolls, allowing citizens to file claims. Opposition parties criticized the exclusions, alleging they favored the ruling NDA. Parliament saw protests and adjournment over the issue. The Supreme Court emphasized en masse inclusion.
title: Bihar SIR: Over 65 lakh voters not included in draft rolls; Patna tops list

author: TOI Education
description: CBSE has announced the Class 12 Supplementary Exam Result for 2025 on August 1, accessible via official portals. Students can download provisional scorecards using their roll number, school number, and admit card ID. Marksheet distribution details are specified for regular and private candidates, and the verification process begins on August 6, 2025.
title: CBSE class 12 supplementary results 2025 declared

He alleges that after Hand was caught lying under oath, her lawyers demanded €3 million, which he refused.

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: China has strongly refuted US accusations of supporting Russia's war efforts in Ukraine, labeling the claims as hypocritical. A Chinese representative at the UN criticized the US for its double standards, questioning why Washington can trade with Russia while restricting others. China maintains it hasn't provided lethal weapons and urged the US to cease blame-shifting and focus on ending the conflict.
title: 'Fire vs lamp': China torches US for hypocrisy over trade with Russia

description: In 1996, Tricia Eleogram and her sister established Sister's Day in Memphis, Tennessee, to celebrate the unique bond between sisters. This day encourages people to cherish their sisters and share affection. The article provides a collection of heartfelt messages, wishes, and quotes to help make Sister's Day 2025 brighter, emphasizing the importance of this special relationship.

Root now boasts 7,220 runs in England, surpassing Tendulkar's 7,216 in India. He also crossed 2,000 Test runs against India at home.

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Harry Brook's audacious shot against Mohammed Siraj, reminiscent of Rishabh Pant, became the highlight of the rain-interrupted final Test. Brook's improvisational six, executed while losing balance, drew comparisons to Pant's fearless batting style. Despite India's earlier innings of 224 and England's quick start, Brook's moment of brilliance captured the attention of fans and commentators alike.

description: Day 2 of the India-England Test at The Oval saw heated exchanges as Prasidh Krishna and Joe Root engaged in a verbal spat, requiring umpire intervention. Shortly after, KL Rahul confronted umpire Kumar Dharmasena, questioning restrictions on player interactions. Tensions escalated post-lunch, reflecting India's aggressive approach in this crucial game.

description: Karun Nair's resilient 57, his first international half-century in nine years, helped India recover to 224 in the fifth Test against England after a shaky start. His former coach, Sanath Kumar, highlighted Nair's mental toughness and perseverance after being sidelined despite a prior triple century.

description: On an IndiGo Mumbai-Kolkata flight, a passenger experiencing a panic attack was assaulted by a co-traveler. description: In a historic move, Sonali Mishra, a senior IPS officer, has been appointed as the Director General of the Railway Protection Force (RPF), becoming the first woman to lead the 143-year-old security force. Mishra, a 1993-batch officer, brings over 30 years of experience from various prestigious organizations.
title: On right track: Railway Protection Force gets first-ever woman DG

description: Major disruptions hit PayPal and Venmo in the US, leaving millions unable to send or receive money. Starting around 9 a.m. ET, users faced transaction failures and login issues. description: Donald Trump ordered the deployment of two nuclear submarines to unspecified locations following a heated exchange with Dmitry Medvedev. Medvedev responded with a provocative statement referencing Russia's Cold War nuclear strategy, prompting Trump's strong reaction and concerns about unintended consequences.

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: India's GST collection witnessed a 7.5% year-on-year increase, reaching Rs 1.96 lakh crore in July 2025, driven by strong domestic revenues and increased imports. Domestic revenue grew by 6.7%, while import taxes rose by 9.5%. Net GST revenue stood at Rs 1.69 lakh crore, reflecting a modest increase, though refunds surged significantly.

description: The Election Commission of India (ECI) has strongly refuted Rahul Gandhi's allegations of electoral misconduct, labeling them as "wild" and unsubstantiated. The ECI stated that Gandhi has not engaged with the commission despite repeated attempts at communication. Gandhi accused the ECI of complicity in "vote theft" and working for the BJP, threatening to expose their alleged actions.

Navarro highlights trade deals with countries like the UK, Japan, and the EU, along with ongoing talks with China, as evidence of Trump's success.

description: Michael Wolff claims a $36 million Palm Beach mansion dispute triggered the downfall of Jeffrey Epstein, alleging Trump bought the property behind Epstein's back, sparking threats and accusations of money laundering. Wolff suggests Trump tipped off authorities about Epstein's activities, leading to his arrest.

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Kamala Harris, promoting her memoir about her 2024 presidential run, sidestepped Stephen Colbert's question about who leads the Democratic Party, emphasizing collective responsibility instead of naming individuals. She reflected on her public service career and the challenges of her campaign, highlighting her commitment to integrity and rule of law. Harris also addressed speculation about a potential 2028 presidential bid.

author: YASH SHARMA
description: Maruti Suzuki continues its dominance in India's car market, maintaining a strong lead in July 2025 with impressive sales figures. Hyundai secured the second position for the second consecutive month, surpassing Tata Motors and Mahindra.

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: The US imposition of 25% tariffs is expected to have minimal impact on India, with over half of Indian exports remaining unaffected due to existing exemptions. Trade between the two nations reached $131.8 billion in fiscal year 2024-25. India remains firm on not offering duty concessions for agricultural, dairy, and GM products, citing religious sentiments.
title: Trump's 25% tariff: India expects minimal impact; agri, GM food no-go areas in trade talks

title: 'Explode like a bomb?': BJP mocks Rahul over EC remark; 'we'll save Constitution'

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Triple H joined President Donald Trump at the White House to sign an executive order reinstating the Presidential Fitness Test in schools, a program aimed at promoting youth fitness through basic exercises. He emphasized the importance of health and fitness from a young age, highlighting its role in setting individuals up for success.
title: Triple H at White House: WWE star joins Trump to revive school fitness — what we know so far

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has dismissed suggestions of strained India-Russia relations following criticism from US President Donald Trump regarding their economic and strategic ties. MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal emphasized that India's bilateral relationships are independent and based on national interests, highlighting the time-tested partnership with Russia and defense cooperation guided by security needs.
title: 'Ties with Russia time-tested': India brushes off Trump's penalty threat on energy imports

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: King Charles and Princess Diana's wedding, though seemingly a fairy tale, was fraught with heartache. Both reportedly cried the night before, Charles due to his lingering love for Camilla, whom he honored with cufflinks, and Diana due to her own reservations. The marriage was further strained by Camilla's continued presence and Diana's struggles, casting a shadow over their union from the start.
title: Charles wept over Camilla night before marrying Diana, insiders share details

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Prajwal Revanna, grandson of former Prime Minister H.D. Deve Gowda, was convicted Friday in Bengaluru in a rape case involving a domestic help. The special court found him guilty of raping the woman at his farmhouse in 2021, acts allegedly recorded on his phone.
title: Rape case: How Prajwal Revanna reacted in court after conviction

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Amid Blake Lively's legal issues involving Justin Baldoni, Travis Kelce has remained a supportive presence for Taylor Swift. Kelce, reportedly wary of Ryan Reynolds' "Hollywood" persona, has always prioritized Swift's well-being. The couples, once frequently seen together, have seemingly distanced themselves, with Lively and Reynolds absent from the recent Super Bowl, signaling a potential shift in Swift's friendships.
title: "He keeps his distance": Travis Kelce saw Blake Lively drama coming — trouble for Taylor Swift
